meta.description: Primary accent color for the interface
meta.longDescription:
Sets the system-wide accent color for GNOME components and supported
GTK4 applications.

meta.description: Enable system-wide dark mode
meta.longDescription:
Whether to prefer the dark color scheme by default across the desktop
environment and applications.

meta.description: Default favorite applications in the dock
meta.longDescription:
List of .desktop file identifiers to be pinned to the GNOME Dash
by default.

meta.description: Whether to enable Gnome Desktop Base Module.
Remove the default GNOME Console
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, the modern GNOME Console (kgx) is added to the 
exclusion list for the environment.

meta.description: Whether to enable Alphabetical App Grid GNOME extension configuration.
Position of folders in the grid
meta.longDescription: Where to place folders when ordering the application grid (e.g., 'alphabetical').

meta.description: Enable system logging for the extension
meta.longDescription: Allow the extension to send messages to the system logs for debugging.

meta.description: Display favorite apps in the grid
meta.longDescription: Allows displaying the favourite apps on the app grid (GNOME 40+).

meta.description: Sort folder contents alphabetically
meta.longDescription: Whether the contents of folders should be sorted alphabetically.

meta.description: Whether to enable App Hider GNOME extension configuration.
List of hidden application IDs
meta.longDescription: Applications that are hidden from the standard app grid.

meta.description: List of applications hidden from search
meta.longDescription: Applications that are hidden specifically from GNOME Shell search results.

meta.description: Custom icon overrides
meta.longDescription: List of [id, icon, path] tuples to manually override application icons.

meta.description: Whether to enable AppIndicator GNOME extension configuration.
Visual brightness of tray icons
meta.longDescription: Adjustment level for the brightness of displayed icons.

meta.description: Visual contrast of tray icons
meta.longDescription: Adjustment level for the contrast of displayed icons.

meta.description: Alpha transparency of tray icons
meta.longDescription: Opacity level from 0 to 255 for icons in the top bar.

meta.description: Visual saturation of tray icons
meta.longDescription: Adjustment level for the color saturation of displayed icons.

meta.description: Fixed size for tray icons
meta.longDescription: Icon size in pixels. A value of 0 triggers automatic sizing.

meta.description: Horizontal spacing between icons
meta.longDescription: Pixel distance between individual status icons within the tray area.

meta.description: Enable legacy tray icon support
meta.longDescription: Whether to support older application status icons in the top bar.

meta.description: Ordering index in the panel
meta.longDescription: Relative order for placement among other panel items.

meta.description: Vertical alignment in the panel
meta.longDescription: Panel box position for the tray icons (e.g., 'left', 'right').

meta.description: Menu toggle keyboard shortcut
meta.longDescription: Keybinding to open the applications menu.

meta.description: Whether to enable Apps Menu GNOME extension configuration.
Whether to enable Astra Monitor GNOME extension configuration.
Experimental extension flags
meta.longDescription: Enable internal experimental features by passing flag strings.

meta.description: Menu header height (Legacy)
meta.longDescription: Visual height of the dropdown menu headers.

meta.description: Left horizontal margin
meta.longDescription: Pixel spacing on the left side of the panel item.

meta.description: Right horizontal margin
meta.longDescription: Pixel spacing on the right side of the panel item.

meta.description: Memory calculation method
meta.longDescription: Logic used to determine 'used' memory (active, etc.).

meta.description: Network speed unit
meta.longDescription: Unit for bandwidth throughput (bits, bytes).

meta.description: Panel box position
meta.longDescription: Placement of the monitor in the GNOME panel (left, center, right).

meta.description: GPU visibility toggle (Legacy)
meta.longDescription: Deprecated setting for showing GPU usage in the menu.

meta.description: GPU usage bar color (Legacy)
meta.longDescription: Color used for GPU monitoring bars.

meta.description: Decimal precision for sensor 5
meta.longDescription: Number of digits to show for the fifth sensor tooltip.

meta.description: Tooltip name for sensor 5
meta.longDescription: Custom label for the fifth sensor in tooltips.

meta.description: Refresh interval for sensors
meta.longDescription: Time in seconds between resource usage updates.

meta.description: Panel orientation
meta.longDescription: Shell bar position (top, bottom, left, right).

meta.description: Storage usage calculation
meta.longDescription: Logic used to determine disk space consumption.

meta.description: Unit for temperature display
meta.longDescription: Unit used for thermal sensors (celsius, fahrenheit).

meta.description: Interface theme style
meta.longDescription: The visual theme for the monitor dropdown (dark, light).

meta.description: Enable high precision sensor readings
meta.longDescription: Whether to show more decimal places for sensor values.

meta.description: Whether to enable Auto Theme Switcher GNOME extension configuration.
Geographic latitude
meta.longDescription: Latitude coordinate used for sunset and sunrise calculations.

meta.description: Geographic longitude
meta.longDescription: Longitude coordinate used for sunset and sunrise calculations.

meta.description: Human-readable location label
meta.longDescription: Custom name used to identify the location in the user interface.

Currently selected animation profile
meta.longDescription:
The filename of the active effect profile (e.g., 'fire.conf'). 
Overridden if 'settings' attribute is defined.

meta.description: Whether to enable Burn My Windows GNOME extension configuration.
Internal version of the extension core
meta.longDescription: Tracks the version of the extension code for compatibility checks.

meta.description: Internal version of last used preferences
meta.longDescription: Tracks updates between the preferences dialog and the extension core.

meta.description: Preferences dialog interaction counter
meta.longDescription: Tracks how many times the settings interface has been opened.

meta.description: Nickname of the effect for preview
meta.longDescription: The effect with this nick will be used for the next window animation.

meta.description: Declarative effect parameters for the managed profile
meta.longDescription: Generates a custom INI profile at `~/.config/burn-my-windows/profiles/nix-managed.conf`.

meta.description: Display the ask-for-support dialog
meta.longDescription: Whether to allow the extension to show its periodic donation dialog.

meta.description: Enable single-frame animation testing
meta.longDescription: If set to true, all animations will show only one still frame.

meta.description: Allow toggling caffeine via command line signals
Active countdown remaining time
meta.longDescription: Internal timer state representing seconds remaining until inhibition ends.

meta.description: Default timer duration index
meta.longDescription: The default index from the duration list used when starting a timer.

meta.description: Available timer duration intervals
meta.longDescription: List of possible timer values in seconds for the dropdown menu.

meta.description: Whether to enable Caffeine GNOME extension configuration.
Auto-inhibit on fullscreen apps
meta.longDescription: Enable caffeine automatically when any application enters fullscreen mode.

meta.description: Auto-inhibit on media playback
meta.longDescription: Enable caffeine automatically when an MPRIS-compatible media player is active.

meta.description: Visual offset for the status icon in the panel
Logical sorting index for the status icon
Maximum index for icon positioning in the indicator menu
Auto-inhibit application list
meta.longDescription: List of applications (desktop file IDs) that trigger caffeine when running.

meta.description: Inhibit GNOME Night Light
meta.longDescription: Mode for suppressing Night Light: 'never', 'always', or 'for-apps'.

meta.description: Default height for the preferences window interface
Default width for the preferences window interface
Restore inhibition state on startup
meta.longDescription: Whether to automatically re-enable caffeine if it was active on shutdown.

meta.description: Allow screen blanking while active
meta.longDescription: Mode for allowing the screen to turn off: 'never', 'always', or 'for-apps'.

meta.description: Indicator visibility mode
meta.longDescription: Controls the top bar icon visibility: 'only-active', 'always', or 'never'.

meta.description: Display status notifications
meta.longDescription: Whether to show desktop notifications when caffeine is toggled.

meta.description: Display countdown in top bar
meta.longDescription: Whether to show the remaining inhibition time next to the icon.

meta.description: Enable quick settings toggle
meta.longDescription: Whether the toggle switch appears in the GNOME Quick Settings menu.

meta.description: Keyboard shortcut to toggle state
meta.longDescription: List of key combination strings used to manually enable/disable caffeine.

meta.description: Application trigger logic
meta.longDescription: Criteria for app-based inhibition: 'on-running', 'on-focus', 'on-active-workspace'.

meta.description: Enable custom duration timer
meta.longDescription: Whether to use custom user-defined values for the inhibition timer.

meta.description: Manual toggle state persistence
meta.longDescription: Whether caffeine should remember its enabled state across sessions.

meta.description: Whether to enable Category Sorted App Grid GNOME extension configuration.
Reorder history on use
meta.longDescription:
Whether to move items to the top of the history list 
when they are selected.

meta.description: Automatic paste upon selection
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, clicking a history item immediately pastes 
it into the active window.

meta.description: Trim whitespace from text
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, leading and trailing whitespace is automatically 
removed from copied text strings.

meta.description: Enable image caching to disk
meta.longDescription:
Whether the extension is permitted to persist copied image 
data in its disk cache.

meta.description: Restrict disk cache to favorites
meta.longDescription:
Disables the registry cache file for standard items, using 
volatile memory only to avoid writing secrets to disk.

meta.description: Maximum registry cache size
meta.longDescription:
The allowed size for the disk-based registry cache file 
in megabytes.

meta.description: Whether to enable Clipboard Indicator GNOME extension configuration.
Enable history deletion controls
meta.longDescription:
If true, displays 'delete' buttons on each item and provides a 
'Clear History' option in the menu.

meta.description: Enable periodic history clearing
meta.longDescription:
Activates the timer-based automatic purging of the 
clipboard history buffer.

meta.description: Autoclear interval duration
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the time in minutes between scheduled 
history purges.

meta.description: Internal state tracker for the next scheduled clear
Clear history on system startup
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, the clipboard history buffer is purged every 
time the system reboots.

meta.description: Confirm history purge
meta.longDescription:
Whether to show a confirmation dialog before performing a 
'Clear History' action.

meta.description: Applications ignored by the extension
meta.longDescription:
List of application identifiers whose clipboard activity 
should not be recorded in the history.

meta.description: Preserve active selection during clear
meta.longDescription:
Whether to retain the currently selected clipboard entry 
when performing a bulk history deletion.

meta.description: History buffer size
meta.longDescription:
The maximum number of copied items to persist in the 
clipboard history.

meta.description: Shortcut to purge clipboard history
Enable extension keyboard shortcuts
Shortcut to cycle to the next history entry
Shortcut to cycle to the previous history entry
Shortcut to toggle Private Mode
Shortcut to display the clipboard menu
Show notification on new copy
meta.longDescription:
Displays a desktop notification every time a new item 
is added to the clipboard.

meta.description: Show notification during history cycling
meta.longDescription:
Displays a notification when cycling through clipboard 
entries using keyboard shortcuts.

meta.description: Enable immediate paste buttons
meta.longDescription:
If true, adds a dedicated button to each menu entry that triggers 
an immediate paste action upon selection.

meta.description: Position pinned items at the bottom
meta.longDescription:
If true, reorders the clipboard menu to place the 'pinned' section 
at the bottom of the list.

meta.description: Menu character preview limit
meta.longDescription:
The maximum number of characters displayed for clipboard items 
inside the extension menu.

meta.description: Topbar character preview limit
meta.longDescription:
The maximum number of characters displayed for the current 
clipboard item in the GNOME top bar.

meta.description: Case-sensitive history search
meta.longDescription: Whether the search filter should respect character casing.

meta.description: Enable regular expressions in search
meta.longDescription:
Allows using advanced regex patterns when filtering the 
clipboard history.

meta.description: Panel display mode
meta.longDescription:
Configures what information is displayed directly in the GNOME 
top bar (icon, text content, or both).

meta.description: Show panel dropdown arrow
meta.longDescription:
Whether to display a visual down-arrow indicator next to the 
clipboard icon in the top bar.

meta.description: Animation time in milliseconds
meta.longDescription: Total duration for the window to transition between visible and minimized states.

meta.description: Animation effect variant
meta.longDescription: Specifies the specific variant of the lamp effect to apply to windows.

meta.description: Whether to enable Compiz Alike Magic Lamp Effect GNOME extension configuration.
Horizontal mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Number of horizontal tiles used to construct the deformation mesh. 
Higher values produce smoother animations but increase CPU load.

meta.description: Vertical mesh density
meta.longDescription: Number of vertical tiles used to construct the deformation mesh.

meta.description: Whether to enable Compiz Windows Effect GNOME extension configuration.
Window movement friction
meta.longDescription:
Determines how quickly window wobble energy dissipates. Lower values 
result in longer-lasting oscillations.

meta.description: Simulated window mass
meta.longDescription:
Determines the inertia of the wobble. Heavier windows feel 'sluggish' 
and wobble with greater amplitude.

meta.description: Enable wobble on maximization
meta.longDescription: Whether windows should wobble when transitioning to a maximized state.

meta.description: Enable wobble on manual resize
meta.longDescription: Whether windows should wobble while being resized by the user.

meta.description: Animation speed divisor
meta.longDescription: Scaling factor for the overall speed of the physics simulation.

meta.description: Spring stiffness constant
meta.longDescription:
Determines the 'tightness' of the wobble effect. Higher values 
make windows snap back faster.

meta.description: Horizontal mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Determines the number of points on the X-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.

meta.description: Vertical mesh density
meta.longDescription:
Determines the number of points on the Y-axis used to calculate 
window deformation.

meta.description: Threshold for recognizing an entry as a standalone character
Display the Unicode codepoint for single-character items
Whether to enable Copyous GNOME extension configuration.
Clipboard clearing behavior
meta.longDescription: Determines which items are preserved when the history is cleared.

meta.description: Maximum clipboard history size
meta.longDescription: Specifies the number of entries to retain in the history buffer.

meta.description: Record primary selection (Middle Click paste)
meta.longDescription: Whether to capture text selected by highlighting as a clipboard entry.

meta.description: Secondary button click behavior
meta.longDescription:
Action performed when clicking the secondary interaction button on 
an item.

meta.description: Immediate paste upon selection
meta.longDescription:
Automatically inserts the clipboard content when an item is 
selected from the menu.

meta.description: Shortcut to cycle through different history filters
Shortcut to remove the focused item from history
Navigation key to move to the next item
Navigation key to move to the previous item
Shortcut to toggle the pinned status of an item
Shortcut to focus the history search bar
Shortcut to select and/or paste the focused item
Keyboard shortcut to show/hide the clipboard window

Custom CSS color for the text and icons
Base color scheme for custom theming
Extension color theme mode
Visibility mode for window header controls
Fixed vertical height for each clipboard list item
Visual orientation of the clipboard menu
Screen position of the floating clipboard window
Display the text content or filename of the clipboard entry
Display icons indicating the data type (text, image, etc.)
Height of the clipboard window as a percentage of screen height
Width of the clipboard window as a percentage of screen width
Transition duration in milliseconds
meta.longDescription: Determines the speed of window movements during the Alt-Tab cycle.

Override the default window switcher keybinding

meta.description: Color saturation reduction for background elements
Background dimming intensity
meta.longDescription: Opacity level applied to the desktop background when switching windows.

meta.description: Mathematical curve used for animation smoothing
Whether to enable Coverflow Alt-Tab GNOME extension configuration.
Force primary monitor display
meta.longDescription:
Always render the 3D switcher on the primary display regardless

meta.description: Hide top bar during transition
meta.longDescription:
Whether to temporarily suppress the GNOME panel visibility when

Backend formatting engine
meta.longDescription: Specifies the library used for parsing and rendering the date strings.

meta.description: Custom date display pattern
meta.longDescription: Luxon-compatible formatting string (e.g., 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss').

meta.description: Suppress the message counter
meta.longDescription:
Whether to hide the unread message/notification indicator next 
to the clock.

meta.description: Horizontal alignment of the date label within its panel slot
Clock refresh frequency
meta.longDescription: Determines update interval (0: minute, 1: second, 2+: sub-second).

meta.description: Ignore the custom-calendar setting and use system defaults
Ignore the custom-locale setting and use system defaults
Ignore the custom-timezone setting and use system defaults
Extension entry action icon
meta.longDescription:
Defines the function of the trailing button on each list item: 
0 for preferences, 1 for removal, or 2 for the extension URL.

meta.description: Whether to enable Extension List GNOME extension configuration.
Activate extension filtering
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, extensions listed in the ignore-list will be 
hidden from the top bar menu.

meta.description: Enable extension name tooltips
meta.longDescription:
Whether to show descriptive tooltips when hovering over the 
toolbar extension list items.

meta.description: Target application for management
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the application ID used to open extension management 
tools or web pages.

meta.description: Display the main extension toggle button
meta.longDescription:
Controls visibility of the primary switch used to enable or 
disable the individual extensions.

meta.description: Display management filter button
meta.longDescription:
Shows or hides the button used to manage ignored or filtered 
extensions in the list.

meta.description: Display link to extension homepage
meta.longDescription:
Adds a button to each entry that opens the developer's 
website or the GNOME extensions page.

meta.description: Display ignore list toggle button
meta.longDescription:
Shows a button that opens the menu for managing which 
extensions are hidden.

meta.description: Identifiers for hidden extensions
meta.longDescription:
List of extension UUIDs or names that should not appear 
in the extension list menu.

meta.description: Show ignore list management menu
meta.longDescription:
Whether to display the sub-menu used for selecting 
extensions to be hidden from view.

meta.description: Display extension removal button
meta.longDescription:
Adds a button to each entry that allows for the immediate 
uninstallation of the extension.

Focused window border pixel thickness
Display border on focused window
CSS color for split indicator
Display split direction indicator
Display preview area during drag-and-drop
Display tab decorations for stacked windows
Suppress gaps for single windows
Multiplier for gap size adjustments
Base gap size between tiled windows

Timestamp of the last CSS injection

Follow-mouse focus policy
Sync pointer location with keyboard focus changes
Pixel increment for window resizing operations

meta.longDescription:
Define as a list of keys, e.g., [ "super" "q" ]. 
Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

meta.description: Shortcut to toggle split orientation

Define as a list of keys, e.g., [ "super" "q" ]. 
Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

meta.longDescription:

meta.longDescription:
Define as a list of keys, e.g., [ "super" "q" ]. 
Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

meta.description: Shortcut to toggle tab decorations
meta.longDescription:
Define as a list of keys, e.g., [ "super" "q" ]. 
Supported modifiers: super, ctrl, alt, shift.

meta.description: Automatically select split axis based on window dimensions
Global tiling mode master switch
Default layout strategy for new windows
Enable stacked layout capabilities
Automatically exit tabbed mode for single windows
Enable tabbed layout capabilities
Indices of workspaces to exclude from tiling
Enable browser integration features
meta.longDescription:
Configures native messaging manifests to allow sharing links 
directly from web browsers to remote devices.

meta.description: Enable verbose troubleshooting logs
meta.longDescription: Activates detailed logging for diagnostic purposes.

meta.description: Default plugin policies for paired devices
meta.longDescription:
A set of default plugin settings that are automatically 
pushed to dconf for every newly paired device.

meta.description: Battery plugin default configuration
Enable alerts for specific battery percentage thresholds
Trigger threshold for custom battery alerts
Alert when remote battery reaches full charge
Alert when the remote battery level is critically low
Transmit battery health data to connected device
Clipboard plugin default configuration
Accept incoming clipboard data from external devices
Broadcast local clipboard data to external devices
Contacts plugin default configuration
Permit contact list synchronization with remote devices
Mousepad plugin default configuration
Allow remote cursor and input manipulation
Media player plugin default configuration
Export media player controls to connected devices
Notification plugin default configuration
JSON configuration for per-application notification rules
Restrict notification forwarding to active session state
Forward desktop notifications to connected devices
Remote command plugin default configuration
Managed set of executable remote commands
meta.longDescription:
Dictionary of commands that can be triggered from a connected 
Android or iOS device.

meta.description: System command string to be executed
Display label for the remote command
SFTP plugin default configuration
Mount remote filesystem automatically upon connection
File sharing plugin default configuration
Automatically open received links in the default browser
Destination path for incoming wireless transfers
Allow remote devices to push files to the desktop
SMS plugin default configuration
Enable compatibility mode for older Android SMS stacks
Volume control plugin default configuration
Permit remote control of desktop audio outputs
Telephony plugin default configuration
Suspend media playback when phone is ringing
Audio behavior during incoming call events
Automatically mute local mic during voice calls
Suspend media playback during active calls
Audio behavior during active call events
Make machine visible on local network
meta.longDescription:
Whether this system should announce itself via MDNS for 
remote device discovery.

meta.description: Whether to enable GSConnect GNOME extension configuration.
Master switch for extension functionality
meta.longDescription: Enables or disables the GSConnect background service and shell integration.

meta.description: Unique machine identifier
meta.longDescription:
The UUID or identifier used to register this machine within 
the KDE Connect network.

meta.description: Maintain background connections during lock
meta.longDescription:
Ensures that devices remain paired and reachable even when the 
desktop session is locked.

meta.description: Network broadcast name
meta.longDescription:
The human-readable label shown to other devices when 
discovering this machine on the local network.

meta.description: Display connection status in top bar
meta.longDescription:
Whether to show the persistent connection status and device 
indicators in the GNOME panel.

meta.description: Whether to enable Hide Cursor GNOME extension configuration.
Idle threshold for cursor hiding
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the number of seconds of mouse inactivity before 
the cursor is automatically concealed.

meta.description: Whether to enable Hide Minimized GNOME extension configuration.
Autohide transition speed
meta.longDescription:
Duration in seconds for the panel slide animation during 
standard reveal/hide events.

meta.description: Overview transition speed
meta.longDescription:
Duration in seconds for the panel slide animation when 
entering the overview.

meta.description: Whether to enable Hide Top Bar GNOME extension configuration.
Restrict intellihide to active window
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, only the focused window triggers the panel 
hiding logic.

meta.description: Enable smart hiding logic
meta.longDescription: Only hides the panel when a window occupies the panel area.

meta.description: Maintain hot corner sensitivity
meta.longDescription:
Whether to keep the activities hot corner active even when the 
panel is hidden.

meta.description: Maintain rounded panel corners
meta.longDescription:
Preserves the aesthetic rounded corners of the top panel 
even in its hidden state.

meta.description: Reveal panel on mouse proximity
meta.longDescription:
Whether to show the panel when the mouse cursor approaches the 
edge of the screen.

meta.description: Enable mouse reveal in fullscreen
meta.longDescription:
Allows revealing the panel via mouse proximity even when a 
fullscreen application is active.

meta.description: Trigger overview on edge proximity
meta.longDescription:
Whether to open the activity overview when the mouse hits 
the panel edge.

meta.description: Edge pressure barrier limit
meta.longDescription:
The amount of cursor 'pressure' (pixels) required to break 
the reveal barrier.

meta.description: Pressure barrier reset time
meta.longDescription:
Time in milliseconds before the pressure barrier resets 
after a failed break attempt.

meta.description: Manual reveal persistence
meta.longDescription:
Number of seconds the bar remains visible after being 
triggered by a keyboard shortcut.

meta.description: Panel visibility keyboard shortcut
meta.longDescription: List of key combinations used to manually reveal the top bar.

meta.description: Enable shortcut toggle mode
meta.longDescription:
If enabled, pressing the reveal shortcut while the bar is 
visible will manually hide it.

meta.description: Show panel in activities overview
meta.longDescription:
Whether the panel should always be rendered when the 
overview is active.

Whether to hide the profile selection button from the

meta.longDescription: Whether to include images found in ~/.local/share/backgrounds.

Primary gradient color for profile 2

meta.longDescription: Whether to include images found in /usr/local/share/backgrounds.

meta.description: Scan system global backgrounds
meta.longDescription: Whether to include images found in /usr/share/backgrounds.

meta.description: Trail alpha transparency
meta.longDescription:
Transparency level of the mouse trail, where 0.0 is invisible 
and 1.0 is fully opaque.

meta.description: Visual color of the trail
meta.longDescription: Accepts a list of RGB floats ([1.0 0.0 0.0]) or a Hex string ('#FF0000').
meta.type: (list of floating point number) or string

meta.description: Whether to enable Mouse Tail GNOME extension configuration.
Trail persistence duration
meta.longDescription: Specifies how long the trail segments take to fade out in milliseconds.

meta.description: Trail line thickness
meta.longDescription: Pixel width for the rendered mouse trail segments.

meta.description: Graphic rendering strategy
meta.longDescription:
Optimizes the trail rendering for either visual precision 
or performance.

meta.description: Action performed on primary mouse click
Action performed on primary double-click
Action performed on middle mouse click
Action performed on middle double-click
Action performed on secondary mouse click
Action performed on secondary double-click
Action performed on mouse wheel scroll over label
Action performed on mouse button 4
Action performed on button 4 double-click
Action performed on button 5 double-click
Action performed on mouse button 5
Target for volume adjustments (application or system)
Whether to enable MPRIS Label GNOME extension configuration.
Primary xesam metadata key to display
Tertiary xesam metadata key to display
Secondary xesam metadata key to display
Text displayed when no media metadata is available
Character sequence used to separate metadata fields
Relative sorting index for top bar placement
Panel container for the label
Comma-separated list of terms to strip from metadata
Custom CSS color for the label text
Maximum character count for the metadata string before truncation
Horizontal pixel padding on the left side of the label
Horizontal pixel padding on the right side of the label
Time in milliseconds between metadata polling updates
Force normal priority for all notifications
meta.longDescription:
Treats all incoming notifications as normal priority, preventing them 
from persisting indefinitely even if sent with high priority.

meta.description: Whether to enable Notification Timeout GNOME extension configuration.
Ignore user idle state for timeouts
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, notifications will always timeout regardless of whether the 
user is currently active or idle.

meta.description: Global notification display duration
meta.longDescription:
Duration in milliseconds after which notifications will automatically 
be dismissed from the screen.

meta.description: Loop navigation at ribbon edges
meta.longDescription:
If enabled, navigating past the last window in a ribbon will loop back 
to the first window.

meta.description: Enable focus-follows-mouse policy
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, window focus automatically shifts to the actor beneath 
the mouse cursor.

meta.description: Use standard GNOME overview
meta.longDescription:
Disables PaperWM's specialized overview and uses the default 
GNOME Shell activities view instead.

meta.description: Whether to enable PaperWM GNOME extension configuration.
Enable touchpad gesture support
meta.longDescription:
Activates custom touchpad swipe gestures for navigating and 
manipulating the window ribbon.

meta.description: Number of fingers for horizontal ribbon scrolling
Number of fingers for switching virtual workspaces
Resistance factor for swipe physics simulation
Responsiveness multiplier for touch input
Shortcut to close the active application window
Shortcut to cycle through windows in the current ribbon
Shortcut to cycle backward through windows
Shortcut to move focused window downward (stacking)
Shortcut to move focused window to the left
Shortcut to move focused window to the right
Shortcut to move focused window upward (stacking)
Shortcut to launch a new terminal window
Shortcut to toggle window between ribbon and full screen
Shortcut to return to the last used workspace
Shortcut to move focus to the monitor on the left
Shortcut to move focus to the monitor on the right
Shortcut to toggle window between current width and full ribbon width
Minimum horizontal window margin
meta.longDescription: The base pixel distance between windows and the left/right screen edges.

meta.description: Minimum vertical window margin
meta.longDescription: The base pixel distance between windows and the top/bottom screen edges.

meta.description: Selection indicator border width
meta.longDescription: Pixel thickness of the border drawn around the currently focused window.

meta.description: Display the navigation minimap
meta.longDescription:
Whether to render the miniature overview of the window ribbon 
at the bottom of the screen.

meta.description: Pixel spacing between tiled windows
meta.longDescription:
Determines the distance between adjacent window actors in the 
horizontal ribbon.

meta.description: Hide scratchpad windows in overview
meta.longDescription:
Completely hides windows in the scratchpad area when entering 
the activities overview.

meta.description: Only show scratchpad windows in overview
meta.longDescription:
Filters the overview to only display windows that have been 
moved to the scratchpad area.

meta.description: Scale factor for window switcher thumbnails
meta.longDescription:
Determines the size of previews in the Alt-Tab and overview 
interfaces relative to screen size.

meta.description: Whether to enable Places Status Indicator GNOME extension configuration.
Target application for dropdown
meta.longDescription:
The desktop entry ID of the application that should behave as the 
Quake-style terminal.

meta.description: Application command arguments
meta.longDescription:
Custom key-value pairs passed to the application upon launch 
(e.g., terminal profile or shell flags).

meta.description: Toggle keyboard shortcut
meta.longDescription: Key combination used to reveal and conceal the dropdown window.

meta.description: Force the window to remain above all other window actors
Visual transition duration in seconds for slide events
Hide the window automatically when it loses input focus
Prevent the dropdown window from appearing in the taskbar or Alt-Tab switcher
Whether to enable Quake Terminal GNOME extension configuration.
Horizontal alignment of the dropdown window (0: left, 1: center, 2: right)
Window width as a percentage of monitor width
Window height as a percentage of monitor height
Specific hardware monitor index to use if primary/current is disabled
Display the dropdown on the monitor containing the mouse cursor
Always display the dropdown on the primary monitor

meta.longDescription:
Dictionary mapping application IDs to specific rounding 
and border configurations.

override is defined.

meta.type: (list of floating point number) or string

Outer pixel border thickness
Preserve rounding for maximized windows
Internal padding values

Whether to skip applications that already provide their own 
native corner rounding.

search window background.

meta.longDescription:
Applies a gaussian blur effect to the desktop area behind the 
search overlay.

Search overlay border color
meta.longDescription: GVariant tuple defining the RGBA components of the overlay border.

meta.description: Visual corner rounding radius
meta.longDescription:
Pixel radius for the search overlay corners. Defaults to 0 for 
sharp square corners.

meta.description: Search overlay border width
meta.longDescription: Pixel thickness of the border drawn around the search interface.

Whether to enable Search Light GNOME extension configuration.

Base pixel font size for search results and metadata
Internal state tracker for available system monitors

meta.longDescription:
Whether to display the search box on the monitor currently 
containing the mouse pointer.

meta.description: Target display index
meta.longDescription:

primary monitor).

Window width relative to the monitor width (0.0 - 1.0)
Alternative shortcut to trigger the search overlay
Primary keyboard shortcut to trigger the search overlay
Display top bar status icon
meta.longDescription:

mouse interaction.

Enable real-time unit conversion inside the search results
Horizontal placement of the workspace bar in the GNOME panel
Visual representation of open apps within the workspace tags
Custom CSS injected into the workspace bar UI
Activate CSS style overrides
Internal flag indicating CSS parsing errors

Whether to always display the workspace index number even if a 
custom name is assigned.

meta.longDescription:
Determines where mouse scrolling triggers a workspace switch 
(e.g., anywhere on the panel or only on the workspace bar).

meta.description: Automatic workspace naming
meta.longDescription:
Whether the extension should attempt to name workspaces based 
on the focused application.

meta.longDescription:
JSON string mapping workspace indices to human-readable labels 
(e.g., '{"1": "Web", "2": "Dev"}').

meta.description: Whether to enable Splash Indicator GNOME extension configuration.

meta.longDescription:
The name of the theme directory found in /share/themes. If using 
`cssOverride`, this becomes the directory name of the generated theme.

meta.description: Base theme for CSS inheritance
meta.longDescription:
The name of an installed theme (e.g., 'Orchis-Dark') to use as a 
parent. This theme must be present in the system packages.

meta.description: Custom CSS rules for GNOME Shell
meta.longDescription:
Raw CSS content to be appended to the shell's stylesheet. If 
provided, a synthetic theme package is automatically generated.

Toggle temperature monitoring visibility
Toggle voltage monitoring visibility
Capacity unit (0: Percent, 1: GB Used, 2: GB Free)
Filesystem mount point to monitor for space
Command to execute when clicking the 'System Monitor' item
Whether to enable Weather Or Not GNOME extension configuration.
Panel anchor position for the weather icon
meta.longDescription:
Determines where the weather information is rendered relative to the 
system clock or panel edges.

meta.description: Whether to enable Window Is Ready Remover GNOME extension configuration.
Whether to enable ZenLink indicator GNOME extension configuration.
Whether to enable installation of extra curated GNOME apps.
Enable Tracker file indexing
meta.longDescription:
Controls the background indexing services for file search and 
metadata extraction.

meta.description: Enable BlackBox terminal theming
meta.longDescription:
Applies system-wide theming, font overrides, and layout configurations 
specifically for the BlackBox terminal emulator.

meta.description: Enable Firefox GNOME integration
meta.longDescription:
Applies GTK4 styling to Firefox via the rafaelmardojai theme and 
configures necessary CSS overrides.

meta.description: Position the bookmarks toolbar beneath the tab bar
Hide the tab bar when only one tab is open
Use standard width tabs instead of expanding them
Enable rounded bottom corners for the browser window
Enable the curated ZenOS GNOME extension set
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, this installs a pre-selected set of extensions 
designed to work together for a premium desktop experience.

meta.description: Extensions to exclude from the curated set
meta.longDescription:
A list of extension names (e.g., 'forge') that should be 
skipped even if the curated set is enabled.

meta.description: Enable ZenOS typography stack
meta.longDescription:
Activates the Atkinson Hyperlegible and ZeroFont overrides for 
system-wide UI, documents, and terminal monospaced fonts.

meta.description: Enable the Zero GNOME clock font tweak
meta.longDescription:
When enabled, this modifies the typography of the shell clock to match 
the ZenOS aesthetic using ZeroMono and ZeroClock fonts.

meta.description: Enable Variable Refresh Rate support
meta.longDescription:
Activates experimental VRR support in Mutter for compatible high-refresh
rate gaming monitors.

meta.description: Enable the illogicalImpulse module
Enable the Syncthing service
meta.longDescription:
Whether to activate the Syncthing file synchronization daemon. This 
implementation uses the ZenOS abstraction layer to map settings to 
the underlying legacy service.

meta.description: Whether to enable the ZenBoot bootloader manager.
Arbitrary bootloader configuration lines
meta.longDescription:
Text content to be appended directly to the generated bootloader 
configuration file.

meta.description: Supplementary configuration file attributes
meta.longDescription:
Attribute set of extra configuration files to be linked and 
included by the primary boot configuration.
meta.type: null or (attribute set of absolute path)

meta.description: Boot menu screen resolution
meta.longDescription:
Sets the resolution for the UEFI frame buffer during boot. 
Format: WIDTHxHEIGHT.

meta.description: Boot device discovery list
meta.longDescription:
Comma-separated list of device types to scan for bootable partitions 
(passed to the internal 'scanfor' command).

meta.description: Animated glow effect color
meta.longDescription:
The hex color code (without #) used for the breathing glow effect 
surrounding the primary icon.

meta.description: The device identifier or hostname shown on the boot screen
Operating system name display
meta.longDescription: The primary text label shown below the hostname on the boot screen.

meta.description: Whether to enable ZenOS Plymouth boot animation.
The hardware or brand icon displayed in the center of the screen
The version or release string displayed alongside the OS name
Trigger store optimization and GC during system reboot
Trigger store optimization and GC during system shutdown
Whether to enable ZenOS Maintenance System.
Retention period for Nix store garbage
meta.longDescription:
Duration after which inactive generations and unreferenced store paths 
are eligible for deletion. Example: '14d', '30d'.

meta.description: User alert interval for maintenance tasks
meta.longDescription:
Determines how often the user is notified about completed cleanup 
or pending updates.

meta.description: Declarative attribute set of system packages to install
meta.longDescription:
Attribute set of system packages to be automatically resolved and 
installed. Leaf nodes can be empty sets to trigger automatic lookup 
in nixpkgs.

meta.description: Complete version string
meta.longDescription:
The final constructed version identifier combining major version, variant, 
and release type. If the type is 'beta', it may include specific revision data.

meta.description: Major version identifier
meta.longDescription: The primary version number assigned to the current ZenOS release cycle.

meta.description: Release lifecycle type
meta.longDescription: Defines the stability track of the current release (e.g., 'beta', 'stable').

meta.description: Version variant code
meta.longDescription:
Indicates the edition or flavor of the release, such as 'N' for the 
NixOS-based edition.

meta.description: Declarative user configurations with automatic integration.
meta.longDescription: Includes direct support for ZenOS Home Manager modules.

meta.description: Batch processing idle interval
meta.longDescription: Idle time to wait after a file is added before creating a processing batch.

meta.description: Whether to enable rule-based (dumb) file sorting.
Minimum batch age for processing
meta.longDescription: Minimum age of a batch folder before the Janitor processes it.

meta.description: Directories monitored for automated sorting
meta.longDescription:
Set of directories to monitor for automated sorting. Each entry 
represents a source path containing rules for moving files.

meta.description: Extension to subdirectory mapping
meta.longDescription:
Mapping of target subdirectories to file extensions for this 
specific watched directory.

meta.description: Whether to enable the ZenFS Janitor automated organization service.
Whether to enable machine learning-based classification.
Delimiters for multi-artist metadata tags
meta.longDescription:
List of delimiters or regex patterns used to split multi-artist 
tags into discrete entries.

meta.description: Whether to enable the Music Virtual Library FUSE mount.
FUSE mount point for virtual music library
meta.longDescription: The target directory where the virtual FUSE view will be mounted.

meta.description: Source directory for raw music files
meta.longDescription:
Path to the source directory containing raw music files to be 
indexed by the FUSE provider.

meta.description: Standard NixOS user options passthrough
User-specific packages with structural auto-resolution
meta.longDescription: (System-level installation, mapped to users.users.<name>.packages)

meta.description: PWA application definitions
meta.longDescription: Attribute set mapping application names to their specific configurations.

meta.description: Desktop entry categories
meta.longDescription: Categories assigned to the generated `.desktop` file for launcher organization.

meta.description: Enable built-in password manager
meta.longDescription:
Whether to allow the backend browser to store and autofill credentials. 
Availability depends on the chosen backend.

meta.description: List of pre-installed extensions
meta.longDescription: Browser extensions to be automatically provisioned within the app profile.

meta.description: Extension ID to install
meta.longDescription: Unique identifier for the extension, e.g., `ublock-origin@raymondhill.net`.

meta.description: Direct XPI download URL
meta.longDescription: Specifies where the extension package can be retrieved for installation.

meta.description: Additional browser preferences
meta.longDescription: Low-level preference strings to be written directly to `prefs.js`.

meta.description: Desktop entry icon
meta.longDescription: Theme icon name or absolute path for the application launcher.

meta.description: Unique web application identifier
meta.longDescription: Used for profile directory naming and internal routing.

meta.description: Search provider keywords
meta.longDescription: List of terms to index the application in desktop search results.

meta.description: Trailing toolbar elements
meta.longDescription: Widget IDs to display at the end of the navigation bar.

meta.description: Leading toolbar elements
meta.longDescription: Widget IDs to display at the beginning of the navigation bar.

meta.description: Application display name
meta.longDescription: Name used for desktop entries and browser window titles.

meta.description: URL interception patterns
meta.longDescription: Substrings that, when encountered by the dispatcher, trigger this PWA.

meta.description: Search engine configuration
meta.longDescription: Defines a custom search engine for the application's search bar.

meta.description: Search engine icon identifier
meta.longDescription: Specifies the icon used for the search engine in selection menus.

meta.description: Custom search engine name
meta.longDescription: Display label for the search engine in the browser UI.

meta.description: Search engine template URL
meta.longDescription: URL containing a `{searchTerms}` placeholder for query substitution.

meta.description: Application home URL
meta.longDescription: The primary address loaded when the application is launched.

meta.description: Custom browser UI CSS
meta.longDescription: Raw CSS injected into `userChrome.css` for interface customization.

meta.description: Custom web content CSS
meta.longDescription: Raw CSS injected into `userContent.css` to modify web page appearance.

meta.description: Internal launch command generator
meta.longDescription: Function used to generate the execution string for a given application.
meta.type: function that evaluates to a(n) string

meta.description: Internal WM_CLASS generator
meta.longDescription: Used to link windows to desktop entries for correct taskbar grouping.
meta.type: function that evaluates to a(n) string

meta.description: Backend browser engine
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the underlying engine for PWAs. Firefox is the primary 
supported backend; others may have limited feature parity.

meta.description: Brave browser package for PWA execution
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the browser package used to run Brave-based web applications. 
The package must support the `--app` and `--user-data-dir` flags.

meta.description: Chrome browser package for PWA execution
meta.longDescription:
Specifies the browser package used to run Chrome-based web applications. 
Supports google-chrome, chromium, or other chromium-based browsers 
that accept the same CLI flags.

meta.description: Whether to enable internal URL dispatcher.
Fallback browser command
meta.longDescription: Command to execute for links that do not match any registered PWA pattern.

meta.description: Whether to enable ZenOS WebApps declarative module.
Path to the Firefox GNOME theme directory
meta.longDescription:
Enables seamless integration with the GNOME desktop by importing the
`firefox-gnome-theme` into generated PWA profiles. This ensures that
web applications match the system's Adwaita aesthetic.

meta.description: List of packages containing native messaging hosts
meta.longDescription:
Specifies packages that provide Firefox native messaging host manifests.
These will be linked and made available to the Firefox PWA edition.

meta.description: Profile storage directory
meta.longDescription: Root path where all PWA browser profiles and configuration will be stored.

meta.description: Whether to auto-start the ZenLink daemon with the session
Enable the ZenLink Android bridge service
The ZenLink package to install
List of files ignored by ZenFS indexing
meta.longDescription:
Patterns or filenames that should be skipped by the roaming and 
categorization services.

meta.description: Whether to enable ZenFS system-wide integration.
Whether to enable roaming user profile support.
Percentage of disk usage that triggers offloading logic
Target disk usage percentage after successful offload
Customized version of the Forge GNOME tiling extension
meta.longDescription:
**Forge (Custom)** is a modified build of the Forge GNOME extension, 
tailored specifically for ZenOS. It includes specific tweaks and 
patches to ensure compatibility with modern GNOME versions and 
integrates seamlessly with the ZenOS tiling workflow.

**Features:**
- Native-like tiling window management for GNOME Shell.
- ZenOS-specific compatibility patches and workflow tweaks.

meta.description: ZenLink status indicator and control interface for GNOME
meta.longDescription:
**ZenLink Indicator** provides a status icon and control interface for the 
ZenLink service. It integrates directly into the GNOME control center or 
top bar, offering quick access to device pairing, file transfers, and 
notification settings.

**Features:**
- Visual status indicator for connectivity.
- Quick access menu for common actions.

meta.description: GNOME Shell top bar clock typography override
meta.longDescription:
**Zero GNOME Clock** is a custom GNOME Shell theme component that overrides the 
default top bar clock font. It uses the custom "Zero" font to provide a minimal 
and stylized clock appearance.

**Features:**
- Applies the "Zero" font family to the clock display.
- Uses `@font-face` injection via generated CSS.
- Includes dconf profile setup for user theme integration.

meta.description: Automatic music tagger and renamer
meta.longDescription:
**Swisstag** is a powerful CLI tool for automatically tagging and organizing 
music collections. It uses MusicBrainz and other sources to fetch metadata, 
lyrics, and cover art, ensuring a clean and consistent music library.

**Features:**
- Fingerprinting via AcoustID (chromaprint).
- Metadata retrieval from MusicBrainz.
- Automated lyrics fetching via Genius.

meta.description: Convenience wrapper for nixos-rebuild switch
meta.longDescription:
**zenos-rebuild** is a wrapper script around `nixos-rebuild switch` 
specifically designed for the ZenOS environment. It provides automated 
session management and user feedback.

**Features:**
- Automates the rebuild and switch process.
- Provides desktop notifications via libnotify.
- Runs inside a tmux session for resilience.

meta.description: ZenOS bootloader automation based on rEFInd
meta.longDescription:
**ZenBoot** is an automated bootloader management tool for ZenOS, built on top 
of rEFInd. It handles the generation of boot entries, manages EFI variables, 
and applies the ZenOS branding to the boot stage.

**Features:**
- Automatic generation of rEFInd configuration.
- Integrated system profile versioning.
- Themed boot menu with custom icons.

meta.description: Automated system maintenance and optimization utility
meta.longDescription:
The ZenOS Maintenance package provides an intelligent background service that
optimizes the system during idle periods. 

**Features:**
- **Smart Idle Detection:** Monitors CPU load to run tasks when user is away.
- **Garbage Collection:** Automatically clears old Nix store paths.
- **Notifications:** Alerts the user when maintenance is completed.

meta.description: ZenOS filesystem hierarchy manager and organization service
meta.longDescription:
Provides the core logic for the ZenFS filesystem abstraction, including 
roaming user profile attachments, automated disk offloading, and the 
Janitor background service for automated file organization.

### Components
- **zenfs**: The primary dispatcher for system-level filesystem hierarchy operations.
- **zenfs-fuse**: A FUSE-based implementation providing virtual metadata-driven views.
- **zenfs-janitor**: A background service that manages rule-based file cleanup and categorization.

meta.description: The Android to ZenOS communication bridge
meta.longDescription:
**ZenLink** (formerly ZeroBridge)

ZenLink uses termux to stream PC audio to your phone and ADB to stream phone's mic and camera to your PC.
It provides a seamless integration between mobile hardware and the ZenOS desktop environment.
Configure using `zl-config` or the gnome extension (`pkgs.desktops.gnome.extensions.zenlink-indicator`).

meta.description: ZenOS signature typeface for UI and terminals
meta.longDescription:
**Zero Font** is a custom typeface designed for the ZenOS aesthetic.
It includes a standard and condensed variant, optimized for UI legibility 
and high-DPI displays.

**Features:**
- Custom glyphs and ligatures.
- Precise hinting for UI rendering.

meta.description: Extended Adwaita icon pack for ZenOS compatibility
meta.longDescription:
**Adwaita Hacks** extends the standard Adwaita icon theme with additional 
icons needed for a complete ZenOS experience. It fills in gaps where 
standard themes are missing specific application or system icons.

**Features:**
- Additional icons matching the Adwaita aesthetic.
- Seamless integration with the default GNOME icon theme.

meta.description: Core iconography set for the ZenOS environment
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Icons** provides the central brand iconography for the ZenOS 
desktop environment. It includes system icons, folder symbols, and 
app icons designed to match the brand's minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Consistent visual style across all sizes.
- High-quality scalable vector graphics (SVG).

meta.description: ZenOS fastfetch theming and ASCII art
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Fastfetch** provides a custom configuration for `fastfetch` that aligns 
with the ZenOS brand. It wraps the standard `fastfetch` binary to load the 
ZenOS preset and ASCII art by default.

**Features:**
- Custom ZenOS ASCII art.
- Pre-configured JSONC preset.
- Global availability without user-level configuration.

meta.description: Branded Plymouth boot animation for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS Plymouth Theme** provides a high-fidelity boot animation featuring 
animated typography and a custom breathing glow effect. It dynamically 
generates assets based on the system's branding configuration.

**Features:**
- Dynamic OS name and version label generation.
- Hardware-specific center iconography.
- Configurable animated glow effect color.

meta.description: Custom rEFInd bootloader theme for ZenOS
meta.longDescription:
**ZenOS rEFInd Theme** provides a clean, modern look for the rEFInd 
bootloader. It includes custom icons, high-resolution backgrounds, 
and configuration settings optimized for the ZenOS minimal aesthetic.

**Features:**
- Fullscreen high-detail banner support.
- Branded icon sets for various operating systems.
- Streamlined UI hiding unnecessary boot elements.
